Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania will be aiming to kick off their Nations League campaign in great manner when they take on Cyprus at S. Dariaus ir S. GirÄ—no stadionas.
Lithuania failed to impress in the EURO 2024 qualifiers, with the team collecting only six points in the process, but they are surely capable of matching Cyprus in front of home fans.
Cyprus aim to build on a routine 4-1 win over San Marino, but beating Lithuania on the road is easier said than done.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lithuania's historical background, including their independence from the Soviet Union and their first official game in 1923.
The capacity of the LFF Stadium, which is 5.067, and that Lithuania play their home games on artificial turf.
Lithuania's most notable footballer, Marius Stankevicius, who played for several top European clubs.
